titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum H
United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum H
titlestmt.author: Fantasia Thorne and Martha Lund Smalley

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:08

did.unittitle: United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum H
did.abstract: This record group represents a continuation of the official archives of the United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia, supplementing and overlapping the papers in record groups 11, 11A, 11B, 11C, 11D, 11E, 11F, and 11G. It provides extensive information about the institutions and projects to which the United Board has lent its support. The United Board was established to support and coordinate the activities of Protestant colleges and universities in China. Following the Communist takeover of China, the United Board focused its efforts on educational work in other Asian nations. In recent years it has re-focused some of its activities on China.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United Board for Christian Higher Education in Asia Records - Addendum H (RG 11H), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: See the annual reports of the UBCHEA in the Library stacks for detailed information about its work during the period covered by these records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The files have been maintained as sent by the United Board.
